ServiceOptionsType.description: This element describes service options, subset type, supported SRSs, interpolation types, formats, exceptions and whether the service is synchronous or asyncronous.

SubsetType.description: This element is used to identify the list of supported subsetting requests.

SupportedSRS.description: This element is used to identify the list of supported Spatial Reference Systems (SRS).

InterpolationType.description: This element is used to identify the list of supported interpolation types. These are used in regridding.

NativeResolution.description: This entity represents the default (native) spatial resolution of the variable in units of km. See the <gml:offsetVector> flag in the DescribeCoverage request for that coverage.

ResX.description: Resolution of the x dimension of the requested coverage or map. (Use ResX and ResY or Width and Height - but not both in the same request).

ResY.description: Resolution of the y dimension of the requested coverage or map. (Use ResX and ResY or Width and Height - but not both in the same request).

TemporalResolution.description: This entity represents the default (native) temporal resolution of the variable in units of km.

SupportedFormats.description: The project element describes the list of names of the formats supported by the service.

Exceptions.description: This field describes the list of exceptions for the service.

Synchronous.description: This provides a field to state whether the service is deemed either synchronous or asynchronous.

ServiceKeywordType.description: This element enables specification of service keywords.

SubsetTypeEnum.description: This element is used to identify the subset type of the variable.

SupportedSRSType.description: This element is used to identify the Spatial Reference System (SRS) of the variable.

InterpolationTypeEnum.description: This element is used to identify the interpolation type of the variable.

FormatType.description: The distribution format of the variable provided by the service.

LayerType.description: The name of the layer (or identifier) available via the service.

SupportedRequestEnum.description: This element is used to identify the request type for the service, GetCapabilities, DescribeCoverage, GetCoverage, etc.

Title.description: The title of the service described by the metadata.

Abstract.description: Abstract provides a brief description of the service the metadata represents.

Description.description: This element contains a description of the service.

ServiceKeywords.description: This element enables specification of service keywords.

ScienceKeywords.description: This element enables specification of Earth science keywords.

Type.description: Specification of the service, e.g. Web Mapping Service.

Layers.description: This element is used to provide a list of layer names (identifiers) which are available via the service.

Format.description: The default format for delivery of the service for the specified layer(s).

Width.description: The width of the requested map.

Height.description: The height of the requested map.

BBox.description: Bounding box corners = lower left (min x, min y), and upper right (max x and max y).

RelatedUrls.description: This element describes any data/service related URLs that include project home pages, services, related data archives/servers, metadata extensions, direct links to online software packages, web mapping services, links to images, or other data.

ContactPerson.description: The name of the contact person who maintains the service.

ContactOrganization.description: The name of the contact organization whhic maintains the service.

AccessConstraints.description: This element with the description field allows the author to provide information about any constraints for accessing the service. This includes any special restrictions, legal prerequisites, limitations and/or warnings on obtaining the service. Some words that may be used in this element's value include: Public, In-house, Limited, None. The value field is used for special ACL rules (Access Control Lists (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Access_control_list)). For example it can be used to hide metadata when it isn't ready for public consumption.

AcceptVersions.description: This element is used to identify which versions of the services are available to accept requests.

Fees.description: The fee for obtaining data through the provided service. The fee is entered as a number, in US dollars.

CreationDate.description: This provides the date (day and time) for which the service record was originally created.

ReviewDate.description: This provides the date (day and time) for which the service record was last reviewed.

ServiceOptions.description: This provides a object to define the set of options for the service.
